investment_thesis.title: Strategic Capital Allocation in the Housing Sector: The Institutional Thesis for Build-to-Rent Communities

executive_summary.core_premise: The 'American Dream' is evolving from ownership to usership due to structural housing deficits and affordability constraints.

market_opportunity.supply_cliff: Expected in 2026-2027 due to dropped starts in 2024-2025
market_opportunity.target_demographic: High-income Millennials (family formation) and downsizing Baby Boomers.

chronic_supply_deficit.description: Housing starts lagged household formation from 2010-2019.
chronic_supply_deficit.restoration_requirement: Addition of 3-4 million homes (2.6% of total stock)

affordability_collapse.consumer_behavior: High-income households (>$75k) becoming 'Renters by Choice' due to negative arbitrage of ownership.

lock_in_effect.description: Homeowners with 2-4% mortgages are disincentivized to sell.

capital_market_dislocation.implication: Creates a 'supply air pocket' for assets delivering in 2027

millennials.description: Primary demand driver (64% of experts agree).
millennials.drivers: Family formation, need for 3-4 bedrooms, student loan debt preventing down payments.

baby_boomers.description: Seeking maintenance-free living and liquidity from home equity.

gen_z.description: Emerging force (49% of experts note impact).
gen_z.preference: Usership over ownership; flexibility for career mobility.

migration_trends.secondary_shift: Spillover into Midwest (Indianapolis, Columbus) due to cost of living.

product_strategy.community_scale: 100-200 homes (Operational sweet spot for onsite staff)

unit_mix_strategy.rationale: Scarcity and higher retention (families change schools less often).

valuation.cap_rate_compression: 50-75 bps lower (higher value) than Class A Multifamily

market_selection.strategy: Barbell Approach (High Growth Sun Belt + Stable Yield Midwest)

primary_markets.name: Phoenix, AZ
primary_markets.status: BTR epicenter, 30k unit inventory, rent premium over apartments

primary_markets.name: Dallas/Fort Worth, TX
primary_markets.status: High supply (18k+ units pipeline), strong job growth

primary_markets.name: Tampa/Jacksonville, FL
primary_markets.status: Strong in-migration (Jax +27% pop growth over 12 years)

investment_vehicle.liquidity_mechanism: Periodic repurchase offers (5-25% of shares) at NAV

risk_management.supply_overshoot: Mitigated by strict underwriting (0% rent growth yrs 1-2) and Midwest diversification.
risk_management.interest_rates: Mitigated by 50-60% LTV leverage and interest rate caps.
risk_management.exit_strategies: ABS securitization (e.g., Pretium $810M deal) or recapitalization.
